sen.j: 御用邸（ごようてい）は天皇家や皇族の別荘である。
sen.e: Goyotei is a second house of imperial family or royal family.
Goyotei is a villa of imperial family or royalty of Japan.
Goyotei is a villa of imperial family or royalty of Japan.

sen.j: 年に数回、静養を兼ねて避暑や避寒で訪れる。
sen.e: Imperial family visits Goyotei several times a year both for rest and summer or winter stay.
The imperial family visits Goyotei several times a year both for rest and summer or winter stay.
The imperial family visits Goyotei several times a year both for rest and summer or winter stay.

sen.j: 宮内庁の定義では、一定規模の建造物と敷地を有するものを離宮とし、小規模のものを御用邸と称している。
sen.e: According to the definition by Imperial Household Agency, a second house with a certain size of building and ground is regarded as Rikyu, whereas the small one is called as Goyotei.
According to the definition by Imperial Household Agency, villas with a certain size of building and site are regarded as Rikyu (detached palaces), whereas small-scale villas are called Goyotei.
sen.cmt: 用語・文法を修正しました
sen.e: According to the definition by Imperial Household Agency, villas with a certain size of building and site are regarded as Rikyu (detached palaces), whereas small-scale villas are called Goyotei.

sen.j: 那須御用邸（なすごようてい、栃木県那須郡那須町、1926年（大正15年）-）
sen.e: Nasu Goyotei (located in Nasu-machi, Nasu County, Tochigi Prefecture from 1926)
Nasu Goyotei (located in Nasu-machi, Nasu-gun County, Tochigi Prefecture, from 1926 up to today)
Nasu Goyotei (located in Nasu-machi, Nasu-gun County, Tochigi Prefecture, from 1926 up to today)

sen.j: 主に8月～9月に訪れる。
sen.e: Visited mainly in August to September.
It is visited mainly in August and September.
sen.cmt: 文法的に修正しました
sen.e: It is visited mainly in August and September.

sen.j: 2008年には明仁・皇后美智子の意向を受けて史上初めて、10月24日～27日という秋の時期に訪れることとなった。
sen.e: In 2008, imperial family visited Nasu Goyotei from 24 to 27 in October on the wish of Emperor Akihito and Empress Michiko; that was the first visit there in Autumn.
In 2008, upon request of Emperor Akihito and Empress Michiko the imperial family visited the Nasu Goyotei for the first time in autumn: October 24-27.
sen.cmt: 表現・形式を修正しました
sen.e: In 2008, upon request of Emperor Akihito and Empress Michiko the imperial family visited the Nasu Goyotei for the first time in autumn: October 24-27.

sen.j: 葉山御用邸（はやまごようてい、神奈川県三浦郡葉山町、1894年（明治27年）-）
sen.e: Hayama Goyotei (located in Hayama-cho, Miura County, Kanagawa Prefecture in 1894)
Hayama Goyotei (located in Hayama-cho, Miura-gun County, Kanagawa Prefecture, from 1894 up to today)
Hayama Goyotei (located in Hayama-cho, Miura-gun County, Kanagawa Prefecture, from 1894 up to today)

sen.j: 主に2月～3月に訪れる。
sen.e: Visited mainly in February to March.
It is visited mainly in February and March.
sen.cmt: 文法的に修正しました
sen.e: It is visited mainly in February and March.

sen.j: 夏季は観光が多いため使用しない。
sen.e: Not used in summer due to a number of tourists.
It is not used in summer due to the tourist season.
sen.cmt: 表現・文法を修正しました
sen.e: It is not used in summer due to the tourist season.

sen.j: 昭和46年に建物が焼失したが、昭和56年に再建された。
sen.e: Though the building was destroyed by fire in 1971, it was reconstructed in 1981.
Although the building was destroyed by fire in 1971, it was reconstructed in 1981.
Although the building was destroyed by fire in 1971, it was reconstructed in 1981.

sen.j: 須崎御用邸（すざきごようてい、静岡県下田市、1971年（昭和46年）-）
sen.e: Suzaki Goyotei (located in Shimoda City, Shizuoka Prefecture in 1971)
Suzaki Goyotei (located in Shimoda City, Shizuoka Prefecture, from 1971 up to today)
Suzaki Goyotei (located in Shimoda City, Shizuoka Prefecture, from 1971 up to today)

sen.j: 主に7月～8月に訪れる。
sen.e: Visited mainly in July to August.
It is visited mainly in July and August.
sen.cmt: 文法的に修正しました
sen.e: It is visited mainly in July and August.

tit.j: かつて存在した御用邸

sen.j: 神戸御用邸（兵庫県神戸市）
sen.e: Kobe Goyotei (located in Kobe City, Kobe Prefecture)
Kobe Goyotei (located in Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture)
Kobe Goyotei (located in Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture)

sen.j: - 1886年（明治19年）設置、現在の神戸ハーバーランドの一部
sen.e: Located in 1886; currently a part of KOBE HARBORLAND.
It was established in 1886, and the site is currently a part of Kobe Harborland.
sen.cmt: 形式・表現を修正しました
sen.e: It was established in 1886, and the site is currently a part of Kobe Harborland.

sen.j: 熱海御用邸（静岡県熱海市）
sen.e: Atami Goyotei (located in Atami City, Shizuoka Prefecture)
Atami Goyotei (located in Atami City, Shizuoka Prefecture)
Atami Goyotei (located in Atami City, Shizuoka Prefecture)
Located in 1888.
It was established in 1888.
sen.cmt: 文法・形式を修正しました
sen.e: It was established in 1888.

sen.j: 現在は熱海市役所
sen.e: Currently Atami city government.
The site is currently occupied by Atami city hall.
sen.cmt: 表現・文法を修正しました
sen.e: The site is currently occupied by Atami city hall.

sen.j: 伊香保御用邸（群馬県伊香保町）
sen.e: Ikaho Goyotei (located in Ikaho-cho, Gunma Prefecture)
Ikaho Goyotei (located in Ikaho-cho, Gunma Prefecture)
Ikaho Goyotei (located in Ikaho-cho, Gunma Prefecture)

sen.j: - 1890年（明治23年）設置、現在の群馬大学伊香保研修所
sen.e: Located in 1890; currently Ikaho training center of Gunma University.
It was established in 1890, and the site is currently occupied by Ikaho Kenshujo (training center) of Gunma University.
sen.cmt: 用語・形式・文法を修正しました。伊香保研修所英語表記参考：http://www.el.gunma-u.ac.jp/~fujii/main_e.htm
sen.e: It was established in 1890, and the site is currently occupied by Ikaho Kenshujo (training center) of Gunma University.

sen.j: 山内御用邸（栃木県日光市）
sen.e: Yamanouchi Goyotei (located in Nikko City, Tochigi Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 「山内」の読み方：「やまうち」か「やまのうち」か特定できませんでした
sen.e: Sannai Goyotei (located in Nikko City, Tochigi Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 山内の読みですが、日光市山内は「さんない」ですので、それに準じて修正しました。
sen.e: Sannai Goyotei (located in Nikko City, Tochigi Prefecture)
Located in 1890.
It was established in 1890.
sen.cmt: 文法・形式を修正しました
sen.e: It was established in 1890.

sen.j: 現在は日光東照宮社務所
sen.e: Currently a shrine office of Nikko Tosho-gu Shrine.
The site is currently occupied by the shrine office of Nikko Tosho-gu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 形式・表現を修正しました
sen.e: The site is currently occupied by the shrine office of Nikko Tosho-gu Shrine.

sen.j: 沼津御用邸（静岡県沼津市）
sen.e: Numazu Goyotei (located in Numazu City, Shizuoka Prefecture)
Numazu Goyotei (located in Numazu City, Shizuoka Prefecture)
Numazu Goyotei (located in Numazu City, Shizuoka Prefecture)

sen.j: - 1893年（明治26年）設置、現在の沼津御用邸記念公園
sen.e: Located in 1893; currently Numazu Goyotei Memorial Park.
It was established in 1893, and the site is currently known as Numazu Goyotei Memorial Park.
sen.cmt: 形式・表現を修正しました
sen.e: It was established in 1893, and the site is currently known as Numazu Goyotei Memorial Park.

sen.j: 宮ノ下御用邸（神奈川県箱根町）
sen.e: Miyanoshita Goyotei (located in Hakone-machi, Kanagawa Prefecture)
Miyanoshita Goyotei (located in Hakone-machi, Kanagawa Prefecture)
Miyanoshita Goyotei (located in Hakone-machi, Kanagawa Prefecture)
Located in 1895.
It was established in 1895.
sen.cmt: 形式・表現を修正しました
sen.e: It was established in 1895.

sen.j: のち高松宮家別邸、現在の富士屋ホテル別館菊華荘
sen.e: Subsequently the second residence of Takamatsu no Miya Family; currently Fujiya Hotel annex Kikka-so.
It was later a villa of Takamatsunomiya Family and is currently used as Fujiya Hotel Annex Kikkaso-inn.
sen.cmt: 形式・用語を修正しました。菊花荘英語表記参考：http://www.fujiyahotel.jp/english/factsheet_en.html
sen.e: It was later a villa of Takamatsunomiya Family and is currently used as Fujiya Hotel Annex Kikkaso-inn.

sen.j: 田母沢御用邸（栃木県日光市）
sen.e: Tamozawa Goyotei (located in Nikko City, Tochigi Prefecture)
Tamozawa Goyotei (located in Nikko City, Tochigi Prefecture)
Tamozawa Goyotei (located in Nikko City, Tochigi Prefecture)

sen.j: - 1899年（明治32年）設置、現在の日光田母沢御用邸記念公園
sen.e: Located in 1899; currently Nikko Tamozawa Goyotei Memorial Park.
It was established in 1899, and the site is currently known as Nikko Tamozawa Goyotei Memorial Park.
sen.cmt: 形式・文法を修正しました
sen.e: It was established in 1899, and the site is currently known as Nikko Tamozawa Goyotei Memorial Park.

sen.j: 鎌倉御用邸（神奈川県鎌倉市）
sen.e: Kamakura Goyotei (located in Kamakura City, Kanagawa Prefecture)
Kamakura Goyotei (located in Kamakura City, Kanagawa Prefecture)
Kamakura Goyotei (located in Kamakura City, Kanagawa Prefecture)

sen.j: - 1899年（明治32年）設置、1931年廃止、現在の鎌倉市立御成小学校、鎌倉市役所
sen.e: Located in 1899 and abolished in 1931; currently Kamakura municipal Onari elementary school and Kamakura city government.
It was established in 1899, and abolished in 1931, and the site is currently occupied by Kamakura Municipal Onari Elementary School and Kamakura city hall.
sen.cmt: 表現・形式・文法を修正しました
sen.e: It was established in 1899, and abolished in 1931, and the site is currently occupied by Kamakura Municipal Onari Elementary School and Kamakura city hall.

sen.j: 静岡御用邸（静岡県静岡市）
sen.e: Shizuoka Goyotei (located in Shizuoka City, Shizuoka Prefecture)
Shizuoka Goyotei (located in Shizuoka City, Shizuoka Prefecture)
Shizuoka Goyotei (located in Shizuoka City, Shizuoka Prefecture)

sen.j: - 1900年（明治33年）設置、1930年廃止、静岡大空襲で焼失。
sen.e: Located in 1900 and abolished in 1930; destroyed by fire in Shizuoka great air raid.
It was established in 1900, abolished in 1930, and destroyed by fire due to Shizuoka great air raid.
sen.cmt: 表現・形式・文法を修正しました
sen.e: It was established in 1900, abolished in 1930, and destroyed by fire due to Shizuoka great air raid.

sen.j: 現在の静岡市役所
sen.e: Currently Shizuoka city government.
The site is currently occupied by Shizuoka city hall.
sen.cmt: 表現・形式・文法を修正しました
sen.e: The site is currently occupied by Shizuoka city hall.

sen.j: 小田原御用邸（神奈川県小田原市）
sen.e: Odawara Goyotei (located in Odawara City, Kanagawa Prefecture)
Odawara Goyotei (located in Odawara City, Kanagawa Prefecture)
Odawara Goyotei (located in Odawara City, Kanagawa Prefecture)

sen.j: - 1901年（明治34年）設置、1930年廃止、現在の小田原城内
sen.e: Located in 1901 and abolished in 1930; currently a part of Odawara-jo castle..
It was established in 1901, and abolished in 1930, and the site is currently a part of Odawara-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 表現・形式・文法を修正しました
sen.e: It was established in 1901, and abolished in 1930, and the site is currently a part of Odawara-jo Castle.

sen.j: 塩原御用邸（栃木県那須塩原市）
sen.e: Shiobara Goyotei (located in Shiobara City, Tochigi Prefecture)
Shiobara Goyotei (located in Nasushiobara City, Tochigi Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 地名誤訳を修正しました
sen.e: Shiobara Goyotei (located in Nasushiobara City, Tochigi Prefecture)
Located in 1904.
It was established in 1904.
It was established in 1904.

sen.j: 現在国立光明寮国立塩原視力障害センター。
sen.e: Currently Shiobara Visual Disabilities Institution, National Rehabilitation Center for Persons with Disabilities.
sen.cmt: 「国立光明寮国立塩原視力障害センター」の正式名称：http://ns.shiobara-nhb.go.jp/
sen.e: The site is currently occupied by Kokuritsu (national) Komeiryo (literally, dormitory of the light, referring to a national vocational training center for the visually disabled) Shiobara Visual Disabilities Institution, National Rehabilitation Center for Persons with Disabilities.
sen.cmt: 国立光明寮名称を補足しました。（wiki見出しに「こうみょうりょう」とあるのは誤りだそうです。正しくは「こうめいりょう」と読むようです。参考：http://www.thka.jp/shupan/journal/200805.html, http://www.ilo.org/public/libdoc/ilo/1985/85B09_513_engl.pdf）形式・文法を修正しました。
sen.e: The site is currently occupied by Kokuritsu (national) Komeiryo (literally, dormitory of the light, referring to a national vocational training center for the visually disabled) Shiobara Visual Disabilities Institution, National Rehabilitation Center for Persons with Disabilities.

sen.j: 一部「天皇の間記念公園」移築
sen.e: Partly removed and reconstructed as 'Imperial Room Memorial Park'.
A part of the Shiobara Goyotei, Tenno-no-ma (literally, Emperor's Chamber), was relocated and has been conserved in 'Emperor's Room Memorial Park.'
sen.cmt: 用語・形式・文法を修正しました。天皇の間記念公園英語名称参考：http://www.nas.ne.jp/nasdb/emperorpark/index.shtml
sen.e: A part of the Shiobara Goyotei, Tenno-no-ma (literally, Emperor's Chamber), was relocated and has been conserved in 'Emperor's Room Memorial Park.'

sen.j: 葉山御用邸は、1926年12月25日、大正天皇の崩御に伴い、皇太子裕仁親王が践祚した。
sen.e: In accordance with the demise of Emperor Taisho in December 25, 1926, Hayama Goyotei was passed to the crown prince, Emperor Showa.
Upon demise of Emperor Taisho in December 25, 1926, Crown Prince Hirohito succeeded to the imperial throne at the Hayama Goyotei.
sen.cmt: 原文のリンク先表示を修正しました。また、誤訳修正、加筆しました。（「践祚＝皇嗣が皇位を継承すること」であり、御用邸を受け継ぐという意味ではなく、皇太子が葉山御用邸にて皇位継承したというのが事実に即した正しい解釈となります。）
sen.e: Upon demise of Emperor Taisho in December 25, 1926, Crown Prince Hirohito succeeded to the imperial throne at the Hayama Goyotei.

sen.j: 葉山御用邸に隣接する場所には昭和天皇践祚記念碑が設置されている。
sen.e: Near the place next to Hayama Goyotei, a monument for the memory of Emperor Showa's accession is built
At the area adjacent to Hayama Goyotei a monument to commemorate Emperor Showa's succession to the throne is placed.
sen.cmt: 文法・表現・用語を修正しました
sen.e: At the area adjacent to Hayama Goyotei a monument to commemorate Emperor Showa's succession to the throne is placed.

sen.j: 那須御用邸は、2007年に御用邸敷地の約半分の570ヘクタールが宮内庁から環境省に移管された。
sen.e: In 2007, half of the site of Nasu Goyotei was placed under the control of Ministry of the Environment from Imperial Household Agency.
In 2007, the control of about a half of the site of the Nasu Goyotei, which was the 570-hectare site, was transferred from Imperial Household Agency to Ministry of the Environment.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れを加筆修正しました。用語・文法を修正しました。
sen.e: In 2007, the control of about a half of the site of the Nasu Goyotei, which was the 570-hectare site, was transferred from Imperial Household Agency to Ministry of the Environment.

sen.j: 移管地は2011年度に日光国立公園の一部とし、一般開放する予定にしている。
sen.e: The site whose administrator was transferred is planned to become a part of Nikko National Park and be opened to the public.
The transferred site is planned to become a part of Nikko National Park in 2011, and will be opened to the public.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れを加筆修正しました。用語・文法を修正しました。
sen.e: The transferred site is planned to become a part of Nikko National Park in 2011, and will be opened to the public.
